<<<code>>>: In the paintComponent method, replace the enhanced for loop for iterating over the beams ArrayList with an Iterator and use the next() method to access the elements.

public void paintComponent(Graphics g) {
    Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D)g;
    g2.setColor(Color.BLACK);
    g2.fillRect(0, 0, 300, 400);
    //Rysowanie gracza
    g2.drawImage(player.getImage(), (int)player.getX(), (int)player.getY(), null);
    //Rysowanie pociskow
    Iterator<Beam> iterator = beams.iterator();
    while (iterator.hasNext()) {
        Beam beam = iterator.next();
        g2.drawImage(beam.getImage(), (int)beam.getX(), (int)beam.getY(), null);
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: The ConcurrentModificationException occurs when you modify the ArrayList while iterating over it. By using an Iterator and the next() method, you can safely access the elements of the ArrayList without causing this exception.
